items.title: Delayed tariff impact starting to hit, could cause companies to reduce head count in 2026
items.description: President Trump's tariffs, aimed at reshoring American jobs lost to overseas manufacturing, could end up lowering head count instead

items.title: Euro zone inflation up a notch to 2.2% in November, flash data shows
items.description: Euro zone inflation stood at 2.2% in November, a slight rise from the previous month, flash data from data agency Eurostat showed Tuesday.

items.title: An industry focused on death faces an existential crisis
items.description: The small, family run companies that make traditional memorialization products like gravestones are facing the dual challenges of tariffs and crematio...

items.title: Consumer confidence hits lowest point since April as job worries grow
items.description: The board's Consumer Confidence Index slumped to 88.7, a drop of 6.8 points from the prior month for its lowest reading in seven months.

items.title: Private payroll losses accelerated in the past four weeks, ADP reports
items.description: Private companies lost an average of 13,500 jobs a week over the past four weeks, ADP said Tuesday.
